author: Vikas Pathak
text:
The CPI (M) Polit Bureau meets here on Tuesday at a time when activists in JNU, a traditional bastion of the Left movement, have been accused of shouting slogans against India and glorifying Afzal Guru, who was hanged for the Parliament attack.

“The Polit Bureau will discuss the ongoing situation and the government’s clampdown on student activists,” CPI (M) leader Prakash Karat told The Hindu . “We are already taking up the issue in a major way. We will mobilise all secular and democratic forces. The way students who went to court for Kanhaiya Kumar’s hearing were assaulted and the police just watched, it is clear what is the line that has come from the Home Minister and Police Commissioner.”

Even as Left activists, including the JNUSU president Kanhaiya Kumar of the AISF, CPI (M)-ally CPI’s student wing, have been booked by the Delhi Police, CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury himself received threatening calls for backing the students.

CPI leader D. Raja also said he received such calls.

The Polit Bureau meet, being held as per prior schedule, will be followed by a two-day Central Committee meet, where the party will discuss its tactical line at a time when West Bengal and Kerala, both crucial States for the party, go to the polls.
title: CPI(M) Polit Bureau meet today
